claim:
After 2 days, the patient’s body temperature was normal and she was discharged from hospital.Results
After culturing for 48 h, gray, translucent, smooth, slightly raised colonies with a diameter of 0.5–1 mm were visible without a hemolytic ring (Figure 1).
title: Figure 1.
caption: Result of pure culture of the bacterial isolate after 48 h.

claim: The gram staining results showed a positive bacillus (Figure 2).
title: Figure 2.
caption: Gram staining of the bacterial isolate.

claim: The MALDI-TOF MS of the isolated strain was most homologous to C. cadaveris with a confidence level of 99.9% (Figure 3).
title: Figure 3.
caption: Mass spectra of the bacterial isolate.

claim: By constructing a phylogenetic tree, it is found that that isolate was located in the same branch as C. cadaveris (Figure 4).
title: Figure 4.
caption: Phylogenetic tree of the bacterial isolate.
